availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William B. Casey (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, iron molder)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, iron molder. Native of Ireland. Married to Margaret Booth Casey in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on February 20, 1855. Father of George Casey, Alfred Casey, Alice Casey, and William Casey. Iron molder in Jefferson County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 3, p. 291B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 8, p. 91A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482708, p. 100.
"William B. Casey (1832-1872)," Find A Grave, Memorial #191699851, accessed November 12, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/191699851.
